name: NSConnectionDelegate
desc: An interface for interacting with low-level, interprocess connections.

items.name: - authenticateComponents:withData:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether given authentication data is valid for a given set of components.

items.name: - authenticationDataForComponents:
items.desc: Returns an NSData object to be used as an authentication stamp for an outgoing message.

items.name: - connection:shouldMakeNewConnection:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the parent connection should allow a given new connection to be created.

items.name: - connection:handleRequest:
items.desc: This method should be implemented by NSConnection object delegates that want to intercept distant object requests.

items.name: - createConversationForConnection:
items.desc: Returns an arbitrary object identifying a new conversation being created for the connection in the current thread.

items.name: - makeNewConnection:sender:
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the parent should allow a given new connection to be created and configured.
